item.title: Hacker News Top Stories: Thursday, October 24, 2024 at 3:20 AM UTC
item.description:
1. Show HN: Wall-mounted diffusion mirror that turns reflections into paintings (131 points | 35 comments)
2. Everything I built with Claude Artifacts this week (380 points | 280 comments)
3. TSMC Cuts Off Client After Discovering Chips Sent to Huawei (37 points | 1 comment)
4. After 16 years of development, Postbox Inc. is winding down its operations (34 points | 7 comments)
5. Chromium uses web search for .internal TLD instead of opening URL (16 points | 3 comments)
6. NetGuard – rootless Android outbound per-app OSS firewall, like LittleSnitch (22 points | 6 comments)
7. Playstation Vita Architecture (Part 1) (143 points | 50 comments)
8. How Do Merging Supermassive Black Holes Pass the Final Parsec? (6 points | discuss)
9. What happens when you make a move in lichess.org? (198 points | 98 comments)
10. Rust in Enterprise Kernels (10 points | 1 comment)
11. Show HN: Open-source low-code email editor (81 points | 17 comments)
12. It has been [33] days since the last Hubris kernel bug (40 points | 5 comments)
13. Necromanteion of Acheron (4 points | discuss)
14. Probably pay attention to tokenizers (192 points | 58 comments)
15. A DSL for peephole transformation rules of integer operations in the PyPy JIT (85 points | 6 comments)
16. My NumPy year: Creating a DType for the next generation of scientific computing (33 points | 2 comments)
17. Irreproducible Results (16 points | 10 comments)
18. Async Rust in Three Parts (91 points | 23 comments)
19. Launch HN: GPT Driver (YC S21) – End-to-end app testing in natural language (92 points | 72 comments)
20. Parks on the Air (81 points | 36 comments)
21. Ground beef stimulates more protein synthesis than soy based meat (20 points | 4 comments)
22. Show HN: I built a task manager that separates "do" and "due" dates (110 points | 49 comments)
23. Reinforcement Learning: An Introduction (2018) (59 points | 13 comments)
24. Taming the buck with a Type III compensator (30 points | 5 comments)
25. Bulk optimization of queries in Postgres (52 points | 3 comments)
26. The Tragedy of Google Books (2017) (393 points | 158 comments)
27. Seeing faces in things: A model and dataset for pareidolia (40 points | 7 comments)
28. RF Hunter, find hidden cameras and other devices (15 points | 4 comments)
29. Goldman and Apple 'illegally sidestepped' obligations to credit-card customers (237 points | 128 comments)
30. DawVert – a DAW project file converter (48 points | 15 comments)
